text: Tagetes subvillosa is a Mexican species of marigolds in the sunflower family. It has been found only in southern Mexico.Tropicos, Tagetes subvillosa Lag. Tagetes subvillosa is a branching annual herb up to 60 cm (2 feet) tall. Leaves are pinnately compound up to 6 cm (2.4 inches) long. The plant will produce several flower heads in a flat-topped array, orange, each head containing ray florets surrounding numerous disc florets.Rydberg, Per Axel 1913. in Britton, Nathaniel Lord, North American Flora 34: 153Lagasca y Segura, Mariano 1816. Genera et species plantarum 29 ==References== ==External links== subvillosa Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Plants described in 1816 Category:Taxa named by Mariano Lagasca
title: Tagetes subvillosa
